column1: Machagai (Spanish pronunciation: [matʃaˈɣaj]) is a city in Chaco Province
column2: Argentina. It is the head town of the Veinticinco de Mayo Department.
referring to its geographical features as a slope near rivers like the Bermejo and Paraná.

column1: Native Argentines like the Qom people used to wander through the area
column2: giving the place its name. After the end of the Argentine Civil War
column3: the government turned its attention to scarcely populated regions of the country like Patagonia and Chaco
column4: and started to promote the arrival of immigrants to populate and strengthen them. The province of Chaco was one of the most transformed by this wave of immigration. In 1909 the first Serbian immigrants from the Austro-Hungarian Empire came to Machagai and founded their agricultural colonies
column5: in 1921 by State decree it was promoted to the category of town. Until the mid 20th century
column6: Machagai continued to receive immigrants from Yugoslavia and Spain.
